title.narrative: Boosting Science and Technology Parks for an innovation-driven economy in Peru.

description.narrative: CONCYTEC has sent a letter on 9th September 2019 to UNIDO requesting support on a) the identification of experts in STP to participate in an International Symposium; and b) to design the implementation steps based on the technical guidelines for the establishment of the firsts STP in the country. The current project proposal will contribute to promote innovation-driven economic growth by strengthening the linkages between the science and research institutions and the industrial sector, as well as to enhance strategic focus for the PCP to leverage on innovation and the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR) opportunities. In alignment with the Peruvian government strategy to assist the industry sector in their digital transformation with the support of appropriate industrial policies and programmes; the assessment of new trends in manufacturing, adoption of 4IR technologies and business models will be pursued by fostering partnerships and investment with the private sector, international organizations and development agencies. More specifically the project seeks to boost regional and sectoral innovation ecosystems by accelerating the development of Science and Technology Parks (STP), and facilitating networking with other existing innovation tools and mechanisms in the country; to realize the commercialization of innovative technological applications locally developed, the transfer of new technologies and investment promotion; for improving SMEs competitiveness, their digital transformation and internationalization. This will be achieved by: I. Supporting the design of the implementation process steps (based on the general guidelines recently approved) for the establishment of STP in the country; II. Promoting partnerships with high-tech institutions, Multinational companies (MNC) and UNIDO ITPO´s network, for encouraging technology transfer, new skills education/training, and investment.
